title: About the ap item changes and some community backlash
body:
I believe we must wait to see how the changes affect the game globally first instead of pointing at specific champs and demand for nerfs ASAP. Many champions will be benefited from these changes, so it would be unfair to start nerfing, for instance {{champion:8}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:50}}...  if everyone is actually getting indirectly buffed. After the changes are done, we can start judging and then fix what's broken. 

Btw, which champion are you the most excited to try with the new ap changes? for me it's {{champion:69}}, I believe she would reach her power spike later considering some of her core items are even more expensive now, but I could actually see myself trying that new {{item:3151}} after the changes, specially with this tank meta. Which item would you like to try and on which champion? 

keep it chill.

replies.body:
{{champion:45}} . Not because he interacts with these buffs too much, but because when the ENEMY has more AP, {{champion:45}} has more AP.

And that's always a good thing.

I agree to some extent that waiting for the changes to be implemented before doing anything regarding nerfs to certain champions is important. However, I do feel like Rumble and Vlad in particular are going to be abused when the item changes occur. They are already strong champions, and the changes in place will definitely make them stronger. For Vlad, WotA is going to rely less on penetration items, and there are more items with higher AP values, meaning he will gain more Health as a result, making for a tankier and harder hitting Vlad. For Rumble, the real benefit isn't that Liandry's is getting buffed (though it does help him considerably), it's that all of his items are getting smoother build paths. Needlessly large rod is almost 400 gold less now, meaning Rumble can back with less gold to buy it. He struggles at staying in lane if he is being aggressive as he has no form of sustain to bring him back up if he doesn't win a trade, forcing him to back and buy smaller items. I feel like Kennen is in a similar situation in how he is going to benefit form the changes. Swain as you mentioned likes these changes too, but I feel like he is going to be left unchecked for a while based on his unpopularity; similar things apply to {{champion:63}} {{champion:90}} and {{champion:74}}. 

As for the champion I'm most excited about, I have to say {{champion:13}}. The RoA and Seraph's combination is going to be pretty strong for him in terms of damage, but he is going to be losing some tankiness, I'm not sure what this means for him but it's what's exciting for me. I'm not sure if he is going to be better or worse for these changes, but it means I get to experiment more with the blue man. WotA is looking good on him. I was packing Luden's/Deathcap as offensive items on him, but I'm not sure what to think with the changes coming in. D-cap is more expensive but will give more AP, whereas WotA is going to boost Ryze's tankiness with increased healing in conjunction with his ultimate at the cost of 100+ AP. I could get both but that doesn't allow for a defensive item and with RoA getting its health reduced, I'm not sure what is better. Second RoA to split the difference?

I just want to play {{champion:143}} .

She's always been one of my favourite mages and the new {{item:3151}} and buffed up {{item:3116}} look really good for her.
Sadly they nerfed the slow from pets from 40% to 20%. As a big Zyra player, I was excited to see Rylai being viable on her, but Rito crushed my dreams....

>Sadly they nerfed the slow from pets from 40% to 20%.

I don't think it will matter too much. Your Q is now a 40% slow, you also have a slow on your ult to help keep people in it. I think that a tanky AP Zyra build mid could be quite strong after the changes. Ie. {{item:3151}} , {{item:3116}} , {{item:3089}} , {{item:3174}} , {{item:3157}} and {{item:3020}}

You lose tons of damage without ludens.

And sadly hp isnt too effective on Zyra because you'll get bursted anyway most of the time

I typically rush {{item:3151}} every game after basics like {{item:1001}}  and {{item:3070}} .

Your AP scalings aren't great, but the early combination of {{item:3151}} {{item:3020}}  makes your plants an actual zone threat, very strong at the objective bosses, and adds a lot of indirect power to your ulti.  A mid game {{item:3116}}  isn't so much for the slow effect as it is for the combination of hp, ap, and double Liandry's damage. 

From there you have a solid universal core to build off of depending on the fight.

When you think about it, this game has more mages and fighters than anything else. It kind of makes sense for those roles to take the spotlight, and have hints such as (true) tanks and assassins be closer to niche than have a meta revolving around them. 

I guess what I'm saying is that there's a variety of mages, whereas we see the same couple of tanks every day in games (Mao, Naut, Sej, Ali, Leona even though she's been top 5 for years). Even if there's nothing but mages in games, I expect there to be a wide variety of them, and not just the few who can deal with tanks. In fact I'm all for middlesticks returning.

I think the biggest thing is that the items haven't gone through pbe yet. I'd be amazed if tear keeps its 20 ap bonus. It'll end up being like 140 ap item if it does in a world where only DC gives more than 100, and ROA (built on most AP champs that go tear) is now the the same AP as all other major AP items. Basically it'll make Anivia and stuff stupid strong in exchange for the charge time, bc instead of giving up early power for moderate bonus late game, it's a 40 AP difference between it and any item that could replace it (45ish w/ bonus % multipliers)
I just think it will be cook to have {{item:3151}}  be more slot efficient, that was a large reason I didn't build it very often.  Now i can try it out on other champs that it may work well on.
